Built to Spill, Godspeed You! Black Emperor, Crumb, YHWH Nailgun, Geese, Nilüfer Yanya, and others will perform at the Raleigh festival in September

Hopscotch Music Festival returns to downtown Raleigh, North Carolina from September 4-6. Earl Sweatshirt, Sparks, and My Morning Jacket have been announced as this year’s headliners, with Built to Spill, Godspeed You! Black Emperor, and Crumb also taking top billing. Yeule, YHWH Nailgun, Geese, Nilüfer Yanya, Hunx and His Punx, Geordie Greep, Florry, and others are also set to perform at what will mark Hopscotch’s 15th anniversary. The three-day festival takes place across two main stages—City Plaza and Moore Square—as well as various clubs throughout Raleigh. Check out the poster below.

Revisit our Sunday Review of Sparks’ No. 1 in Heaven, and read about Godspeed You! Black Emperor and My Morning Jacket in “The 200 Best Albums of the 2000s.”
